div.pre: 1963 Vibo Valentia (= Hipponium; for- (1159) merly Monteleone), Bruttium, 1927 Burial: c. 280 B.C.? (K) Contents: c. 70 AR Metapontum Thurium Velia: 7 st. Croton: 4 st. (3 incuse; 1 Apollo hd./tripod) Locri: 9 st. (8 Pegasi; 1 Zeus/eagle) Terina: 1 st. Disposition: Reggio (in 1969) 4 (1 Croton dumpy incuse; 1 Croton Apollo hd./ tripod; 1 Velia; 1 Pegasus) Toraldo, NSc 1928, p. 240 Catanuto, NSc 1932, pp. 393-4 The hd. was originally reported to contain Metapontum, Thurium, Velia and Locri, which is probably the most reliable description of its contents. The material eventually confiscated con- sisted of the last four items above, together with a miscellany of Greek, Roman and modern AE
